str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stop, close up, obstruct. Apparently a strengthening form of the base of phren; to fence or inclose, i.e., to block up.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Answerable to, liable to (brought under) the judgment of. From hupo and dike; under sentence, i.e. condemned.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
